tools.name: uav_fly
tools.description: Input: a dictionary with x, y, z coordinates and yaw (°). Used to move the drone to the specified position and orientation. Returns True on success.

tools.name: car_run
tools.description: Input: a dictionary with x, y coordinates and yaw (°). Used to move the car to the specified position and orientation. Returns True on success.

tools.name: arm_grasp
tools.description: Input: string 'grasp' to let the robotic arm pick up the object in front. Input 'put' to place the object back. Returns True on success.

tools.name: dog_run
tools.description: Input: a dictionary with x, y coordinates. Used to move the robot dog to the specified position and orientation. Returns True on success.

tools.name: vlm
tools.description: No input. Captures an image from the drone camera and uses a vision-language model to return a text description of the environment, but without accurate coordinates.

tools.name: object_detection
tools.description: No input. Captures an image from the camera and uses an object detection model to return a text description of the environment. world_coordinates = nan means the object is far away. If no objects are detected, the environment simply has none; this is normal.

tools.name: object_detection_json
tools.description: No input. Captures an image from the camera and returns JSON dictionary data from the object detection model. The field ['objects'] is a list, and each element's ['name'] and ['world_coordinates'] represent the object's name and position. world_coordinates = nan means the object is far away.

tools.name: speak
tools.description: Input: a text string. The drone uses its speaker to output the audio. Returns True on success.

tools.name: listen
tools.description: No input. The drone listens to the environment and returns the recognized text.
